utils.config_compatibility¶

Source: src\utils\config_compatibility.py

Module Overview¶

Configuration compatibility utilities.

This module provides compatibility between dictionary-based and object-based configuration access patterns, enabling seamless integration between different configuration systems used throughout the project.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========================= src/utils/config_compatibility.py ==========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Configuration compatibility utilities.
  7
  8This module provides compatibility between dictionary-based and object-based
  9configuration access patterns, enabling seamless integration between different
 10configuration systems used throughout the project.
 11"""
 12
 13from typing import Dict, Any, Union
 14import warnings
 15
 16
 17class AttributeDictionary:
 18    """
 19    Dictionary-like object that supports both dictionary and attribute access.
 20
 21    This class wraps dictionaries to provide attribute access (obj.key) while
 22    maintaining dictionary access (obj['key']) for maximum compatibility.
 23    """
 24
 25    def __init__(self, data: Dict[str, Any]):
 26        """
 27        Initialize with dictionary data.
 28
 29        Args:
 30            data: Dictionary to wrap with attribute access
 31        """
 32        self._data = data
 33
 34    def __getattr__(self, name: str) -> Any:
 35        """Get attribute using dot notation."""
 36        if name.startswith('_'):
 37            # Avoid infinite recursion for internal attributes
 38            raise AttributeError(f"'{self.__class__.__name__}' object has no attribute '{name}'")
 39
 40        try:
 41            return self._data[name]
 42        except KeyError:
 43            raise AttributeError(f"'{self.__class__.__name__}' object has no attribute '{name}'")
 44
 45    def __getitem__(self, key: str) -> Any:
 46        """Get item using dictionary notation."""
 47        return self._data[key]
 48
 49    def __setattr__(self, name: str, value: Any) -> None:
 50        """Set attribute."""
 51        if name.startswith('_'):
 52            super().__setattr__(name, value)
 53        else:
 54            if not hasattr(self, '_data'):
 55                super().__setattr__('_data', {})
 56            self._data[name] = value
 57
 58    def __setitem__(self, key: str, value: Any) -> None:
 59        """Set item using dictionary notation."""
 60        self._data[key] = value
 61
 62    def __contains__(self, key: str) -> bool:
 63        """Check if key exists."""
 64        return key in self._data
 65
 66    def get(self, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
 67        """Get value with default."""
 68        return self._data.get(key, default)
 69
 70    def keys(self):
 71        """Get dictionary keys."""
 72        return self._data.keys()
 73
 74    def values(self):
 75        """Get dictionary values."""
 76        return self._data.values()
 77
 78    def items(self):
 79        """Get dictionary items."""
 80        return self._data.items()
 81
 82    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 83        """Convert back to plain dictionary."""
 84        return self._data.copy()
 85
 86    def __repr__(self) -> str:
 87        """String representation."""
 88        return f"AttributeDictionary({self._data})"
 89
 90
 91def ensure_attribute_access(config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Any:
 92    """
 93    Ensure configuration supports attribute access.
 94
 95    This function takes either a dictionary or an object and ensures that
 96    the result supports attribute access (obj.key) for compatibility with
 97    code that expects configuration objects.
 98
 99    Args:
100        config: Configuration as dictionary or object
101
102    Returns:
103        Configuration object supporting attribute access
104    """
105    if config is None:
106        return None
107
108    # If it's already an object with the attributes we need, return as-is
109    if hasattr(config, '__dict__') and not isinstance(config, dict):
110        return config
111
112    # If it's a dictionary, wrap it
113    if isinstance(config, dict):
114        return AttributeDictionary(config)
115
116    # Otherwise assume it's already compatible
117    return config
118
119
120def ensure_dict_access(config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
121    """
122    Ensure configuration is a dictionary.
123
124    This function takes either a dictionary or an object and ensures that
125    the result is a plain dictionary for compatibility with code that
126    expects dictionary access.
127
128    Args:
129        config: Configuration as dictionary or object
130
131    Returns:
132        Configuration as dictionary
133    """
134    if config is None:
135        return {}
136
137    # If it's already a dictionary, return as-is
138    if isinstance(config, dict):
139        return config
140
141    # If it's an AttributeDictionary, extract the data
142    if isinstance(config, AttributeDictionary):
143        return config.to_dict()
144
145    # If it has a model_dump method (Pydantic), use it
146    if hasattr(config, 'model_dump'):
147        return config.model_dump()
148
149    # If it has a dict method, use it
150    if hasattr(config, 'dict'):
151        return config.dict()
152
153    # If it has __dict__, use it
154    if hasattr(config, '__dict__'):
155        return config.__dict__
156
157    # Last resort: try to convert
158    try:
159        return dict(config)
160    except (TypeError, ValueError):
161        warnings.warn(f"Could not convert configuration of type {type(config)} to dictionary")
162        return {}
163
164
165class ConfigCompatibilityMixin:
166    """
167    Mixin class for components that need configuration compatibility.
168
169    This mixin provides methods to handle both dictionary and object-based
170    configurations seamlessly.
171    """
172
173    def _ensure_config_compatibility(self, config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Any:
174        """Ensure configuration has attribute access."""
175        return ensure_attribute_access(config)
176
177    def _ensure_config_dict(self, config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
178        """Ensure configuration is a dictionary."""
179        return ensure_dict_access(config)
180
181
182def wrap_physics_config(physics_config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Any:
183    """
184    Wrap physics configuration for compatibility with plant models.
185
186    This function specifically handles physics configurations that need
187    to work with both the configuration loading system and the plant
188    model implementations. It also provides parameter name mapping
189    and default values for missing parameters.
190
191    Args:
192        physics_config: Physics configuration from config loading
193
194    Returns:
195        Configuration compatible with plant model requirements
196    """
197    # Convert to dictionary first
198    config_dict = ensure_dict_access(physics_config)
199
200    # Handle parameter name mappings and add missing defaults
201    enhanced_config = config_dict.copy()
202
203    # Parameter name mappings
204    if 'regularization' in config_dict and 'regularization_alpha' not in config_dict:
205        enhanced_config['regularization_alpha'] = config_dict['regularization']
206
207    # Add missing default parameters
208    defaults = {
209        'regularization_alpha': enhanced_config.get('regularization', 1e-8),
210        'max_condition_number': 1e12,
211        'min_regularization': 1e-10,
212        'use_fixed_regularization': False,
213        # Required physics parameters with sensible defaults
214        'cart_mass': 1.0,
215        'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
216        'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
217        'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
218        'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
219        'pendulum1_com': 0.25,  # Half of pendulum1_length
220        'pendulum2_com': 0.25,  # Half of pendulum2_length
221        'pendulum1_inertia': 0.02,
222        'pendulum2_inertia': 0.02,
223        'gravity': 9.81,
224        # Additional parameters needed for full dynamics validation
225        'cart_position_limits': (-5.0, 5.0),  # meters
226        'cart_velocity_limit': 10.0,  # m/s
227        'joint_velocity_limits': 20.0,  # rad/s
228        'max_control_force': 200.0,  # N
229        'control_rate_limit': 1000.0,  # N/s
230        # Full dynamics specific parameters
231        'include_coriolis_effects': True,
232        'include_centrifugal_effects': True,
233        'include_friction': True,
234        'include_disturbances': False,
235        'nonlinear_effects': True,
236        'advanced_integration': True,
237        'wind_effects': False
238    }
239
240    for key, default_value in defaults.items():
241        if key not in enhanced_config:
242            enhanced_config[key] = default_value
243
244    # Return as AttributeDictionary for attribute access
245    return ensure_attribute_access(enhanced_config)
246
247
248# Commonly used physics parameters for validation
249REQUIRED_PHYSICS_PARAMS = {
250    'cart_mass', 'pendulum1_mass', 'pendulum2_mass',
251    'pendulum1_length', 'pendulum2_length',
252    'pendulum1_com', 'pendulum2_com',
253    'pendulum1_inertia', 'pendulum2_inertia',
254    'gravity'
255}
256
257def validate_physics_config(config: Any) -> bool:
258    """
259    Validate that physics configuration has required parameters.
260
261    Args:
262        config: Configuration to validate
263
264    Returns:
265        True if configuration has all required physics parameters
266    """
267    for param in REQUIRED_PHYSICS_PARAMS:
268        if not hasattr(config, param) and (not isinstance(config, dict) or param not in config):
269            return False
270    return True
271
272
273def create_minimal_physics_config() -> AttributeDictionary:
274    """
275    Create a minimal physics configuration with default values.
276
277    Returns:
278        Minimal configuration with default physics parameters
279    """
280    return AttributeDictionary({
281        'cart_mass': 1.0,
282        'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
283        'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
284        'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
285        'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
286        'pendulum1_com': 0.25,
287        'pendulum2_com': 0.25,
288        'pendulum1_inertia': 0.01,
289        'pendulum2_inertia': 0.01,
290        'gravity': 9.81,
291        'regularization_alpha': 1e-8,
292        'max_condition_number': 1e12,
293        'min_regularization': 1e-10,
294        'use_fixed_regularization': False,
295    })

Classes¶

AttributeDictionary¶

Dictionary-like object that supports both dictionary and attribute access.

This class wraps dictionaries to provide attribute access (obj.key) while maintaining dictionary access (obj[‘key’]) for maximum compatibility.

Source Code¶

 1class AttributeDictionary:
 2    """
 3    Dictionary-like object that supports both dictionary and attribute access.
 4
 5    This class wraps dictionaries to provide attribute access (obj.key) while
 6    maintaining dictionary access (obj['key']) for maximum compatibility.
 7    """
 8
 9    def __init__(self, data: Dict[str, Any]):
10        """
11        Initialize with dictionary data.
12
13        Args:
14            data: Dictionary to wrap with attribute access
15        """
16        self._data = data
17
18    def __getattr__(self, name: str) -> Any:
19        """Get attribute using dot notation."""
20        if name.startswith('_'):
21            # Avoid infinite recursion for internal attributes
22            raise AttributeError(f"'{self.__class__.__name__}' object has no attribute '{name}'")
23
24        try:
25            return self._data[name]
26        except KeyError:
27            raise AttributeError(f"'{self.__class__.__name__}' object has no attribute '{name}'")
28
29    def __getitem__(self, key: str) -> Any:
30        """Get item using dictionary notation."""
31        return self._data[key]
32
33    def __setattr__(self, name: str, value: Any) -> None:
34        """Set attribute."""
35        if name.startswith('_'):
36            super().__setattr__(name, value)
37        else:
38            if not hasattr(self, '_data'):
39                super().__setattr__('_data', {})
40            self._data[name] = value
41
42    def __setitem__(self, key: str, value: Any) -> None:
43        """Set item using dictionary notation."""
44        self._data[key] = value
45
46    def __contains__(self, key: str) -> bool:
47        """Check if key exists."""
48        return key in self._data
49
50    def get(self, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
51        """Get value with default."""
52        return self._data.get(key, default)
53
54    def keys(self):
55        """Get dictionary keys."""
56        return self._data.keys()
57
58    def values(self):
59        """Get dictionary values."""
60        return self._data.values()
61
62    def items(self):
63        """Get dictionary items."""
64        return self._data.items()
65
66    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
67        """Convert back to plain dictionary."""
68        return self._data.copy()
69
70    def __repr__(self) -> str:
71        """String representation."""
72        return f"AttributeDictionary({self._data})"

ConfigCompatibilityMixin¶

Mixin class for components that need configuration compatibility.

This mixin provides methods to handle both dictionary and object-based configurations seamlessly.

Source Code¶

 1class ConfigCompatibilityMixin:
 2    """
 3    Mixin class for components that need configuration compatibility.
 4
 5    This mixin provides methods to handle both dictionary and object-based
 6    configurations seamlessly.
 7    """
 8
 9    def _ensure_config_compatibility(self, config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Any:
10        """Ensure configuration has attribute access."""
11        return ensure_attribute_access(config)
12
13    def _ensure_config_dict(self, config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
14        """Ensure configuration is a dictionary."""
15        return ensure_dict_access(config)

Functions¶

ensure_attribute_access(config)¶

Ensure configuration supports attribute access.

This function takes either a dictionary or an object and ensures that the result supports attribute access (obj.key) for compatibility with code that expects configuration objects.

Args: config: Configuration as dictionary or object

Returns: Configuration object supporting attribute access

Source Code¶

 1def ensure_attribute_access(config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Any:
 2    """
 3    Ensure configuration supports attribute access.
 4
 5    This function takes either a dictionary or an object and ensures that
 6    the result supports attribute access (obj.key) for compatibility with
 7    code that expects configuration objects.
 8
 9    Args:
10        config: Configuration as dictionary or object
11
12    Returns:
13        Configuration object supporting attribute access
14    """
15    if config is None:
16        return None
17
18    # If it's already an object with the attributes we need, return as-is
19    if hasattr(config, '__dict__') and not isinstance(config, dict):
20        return config
21
22    # If it's a dictionary, wrap it
23    if isinstance(config, dict):
24        return AttributeDictionary(config)
25
26    # Otherwise assume it's already compatible
27    return config

ensure_dict_access(config)¶

Ensure configuration is a dictionary.

This function takes either a dictionary or an object and ensures that the result is a plain dictionary for compatibility with code that expects dictionary access.

Args: config: Configuration as dictionary or object

Returns: Configuration as dictionary

Source Code¶

 1def ensure_dict_access(config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 2    """
 3    Ensure configuration is a dictionary.
 4
 5    This function takes either a dictionary or an object and ensures that
 6    the result is a plain dictionary for compatibility with code that
 7    expects dictionary access.
 8
 9    Args:
10        config: Configuration as dictionary or object
11
12    Returns:
13        Configuration as dictionary
14    """
15    if config is None:
16        return {}
17
18    # If it's already a dictionary, return as-is
19    if isinstance(config, dict):
20        return config
21
22    # If it's an AttributeDictionary, extract the data
23    if isinstance(config, AttributeDictionary):
24        return config.to_dict()
25
26    # If it has a model_dump method (Pydantic), use it
27    if hasattr(config, 'model_dump'):
28        return config.model_dump()
29
30    # If it has a dict method, use it
31    if hasattr(config, 'dict'):
32        return config.dict()
33
34    # If it has __dict__, use it
35    if hasattr(config, '__dict__'):
36        return config.__dict__
37
38    # Last resort: try to convert
39    try:
40        return dict(config)
41    except (TypeError, ValueError):
42        warnings.warn(f"Could not convert configuration of type {type(config)} to dictionary")
43        return {}

wrap_physics_config(physics_config)¶

Wrap physics configuration for compatibility with plant models.

This function specifically handles physics configurations that need to work with both the configuration loading system and the plant model implementations. It also provides parameter name mapping and default values for missing parameters.

Args: physics_config: Physics configuration from config loading

Returns: Configuration compatible with plant model requirements

Source Code¶

 1def wrap_physics_config(physics_config: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any]) -> Any:
 2    """
 3    Wrap physics configuration for compatibility with plant models.
 4
 5    This function specifically handles physics configurations that need
 6    to work with both the configuration loading system and the plant
 7    model implementations. It also provides parameter name mapping
 8    and default values for missing parameters.
 9
10    Args:
11        physics_config: Physics configuration from config loading
12
13    Returns:
14        Configuration compatible with plant model requirements
15    """
16    # Convert to dictionary first
17    config_dict = ensure_dict_access(physics_config)
18
19    # Handle parameter name mappings and add missing defaults
20    enhanced_config = config_dict.copy()
21
22    # Parameter name mappings
23    if 'regularization' in config_dict and 'regularization_alpha' not in config_dict:
24        enhanced_config['regularization_alpha'] = config_dict['regularization']
25
26    # Add missing default parameters
27    defaults = {
28        'regularization_alpha': enhanced_config.get('regularization', 1e-8),
29        'max_condition_number': 1e12,
30        'min_regularization': 1e-10,
31        'use_fixed_regularization': False,
32        # Required physics parameters with sensible defaults
33        'cart_mass': 1.0,
34        'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
35        'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
36        'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
37        'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
38        'pendulum1_com': 0.25,  # Half of pendulum1_length
39        'pendulum2_com': 0.25,  # Half of pendulum2_length
40        'pendulum1_inertia': 0.02,
41        'pendulum2_inertia': 0.02,
42        'gravity': 9.81,
43        # Additional parameters needed for full dynamics validation
44        'cart_position_limits': (-5.0, 5.0),  # meters
45        'cart_velocity_limit': 10.0,  # m/s
46        'joint_velocity_limits': 20.0,  # rad/s
47        'max_control_force': 200.0,  # N
48        'control_rate_limit': 1000.0,  # N/s
49        # Full dynamics specific parameters
50        'include_coriolis_effects': True,
51        'include_centrifugal_effects': True,
52        'include_friction': True,
53        'include_disturbances': False,
54        'nonlinear_effects': True,
55        'advanced_integration': True,
56        'wind_effects': False
57    }
58
59    for key, default_value in defaults.items():
60        if key not in enhanced_config:
61            enhanced_config[key] = default_value
62
63    # Return as AttributeDictionary for attribute access
64    return ensure_attribute_access(enhanced_config)

validate_physics_config(config)¶

Validate that physics configuration has required parameters.

Args: config: Configuration to validate

Returns: True if configuration has all required physics parameters

Source Code¶

 1def validate_physics_config(config: Any) -> bool:
 2    """
 3    Validate that physics configuration has required parameters.
 4
 5    Args:
 6        config: Configuration to validate
 7
 8    Returns:
 9        True if configuration has all required physics parameters
10    """
11    for param in REQUIRED_PHYSICS_PARAMS:
12        if not hasattr(config, param) and (not isinstance(config, dict) or param not in config):
13            return False
14    return True

create_minimal_physics_config()¶

Create a minimal physics configuration with default values.

Returns: Minimal configuration with default physics parameters

Source Code¶

 1def create_minimal_physics_config() -> AttributeDictionary:
 2    """
 3    Create a minimal physics configuration with default values.
 4
 5    Returns:
 6        Minimal configuration with default physics parameters
 7    """
 8    return AttributeDictionary({
 9        'cart_mass': 1.0,
10        'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
11        'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
12        'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
13        'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
14        'pendulum1_com': 0.25,
15        'pendulum2_com': 0.25,
16        'pendulum1_inertia': 0.01,
17        'pendulum2_inertia': 0.01,
18        'gravity': 9.81,
19        'regularization_alpha': 1e-8,
20        'max_condition_number': 1e12,
21        'min_regularization': 1e-10,
22        'use_fixed_regularization': False,
23    })
